title: Psychological aspects of dialysis: a Semantic Differential study
abstract: SYNOPSIS Twenty-one patients on The Royal Free Hospital dialysis programme and 21 control subjects were examined using the Semantic Differential. Results were analysed by the method of check-style analysis and by a comparison of concept profiles for the 2 groups using a multivariate analysis program. A highly significant difference ( p < 0·001) was found between the check-styles of dialysis and control groups. The implications of this finding are discussed. Three concepts were selected for particular study: ‘my self’, ‘my ideal self’ and ‘people’. There were significant differences in profiles between the 2 groups on all 3 concepts. Subgroup analysis showed further differences for sex, age and length of time on dialysis.
